definition[0]: a price that is definite and that cannot be reduced or increased
example[0]: Over the first five years of the contract, most of the gas will be sold at a fixed price.
definition[1]: an official price for a product or service, set by a government. When the amount has been set, it is illegal to sell the item above this price
example[1]: The taxis charge a fixed price and are regulated by the city government.
